item.title: Alleyway a tip, 24th November
item.description:
This has been reported multiple times across the last month but nothing has been done. The alleyway is full of discarded drinks cans, a slowly rotting takeaway for eight and other rubbish to create a disgusting (widely used) thoroughfare.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Footpath From Comberton Road To Southwold Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stanley House, 24th November
item.description:
Road works carried out by Marlborough Contractors one of contractors used by Camden. Caller states that the concrete edging is going to be taken out to install a side gulley - this is going to cause serious issues with the mud caused by rains in the future, which will block the drain. The contractors have referred the resident to Camden, saying they are doing what Camden ordered. A complaint has been already Please can you contact the customer as it is a bit confusing as to what works are going on.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 107, Belsize Road, South Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 29 & 27, 24th November
item.description:
The pavement needs to be swept of leaves that have fallen from the trees in the street. The dead leaves are very slippery and we have a high level of footfall on the road visiting the heath. Other areas of the pavement has been swept but not outside 27 and 29. Many Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Well Walk, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
